title: NaOH-HCl titration curve - heat released double mL

content.prompt: A student conducted an experiment to determine Δ H rxn ∘ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahGart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGuoGaamisam aaDaaaleaacaWGYbGaamiEaiaad6gaaeaacqWIyiYBaaaaaa@3F33@ for the reaction between HCl ( a q ) and NaOH ( a q ) . The student ran two trials using the volumes of HCl ( a q ) and NaOH ( a q ) indicated in the table above, and determined the amount of heat released. Which of the following best explains the relationship between X and Y?

choices.label: Y = 2X, because the volume of HCl(aq) used in trial 2 is twice the volume used in trial 1.
Y = X, because the number of moles of acid and base reacting with each other is the same in both trials.
Y = 2X / 3 , because the heat is distributed over more particles in trial 2 than in trial 1.
The relationship between X and Y cannot be predicted.

skill.text: 6.F: Explain the connection between experimental results and chemical concepts, processes, or theories.
